column4: As for writing to NTFS mounts... in myh own experience it works fine. It's not guaranteed because it may spetacularly fail if you do something worng (such as turning off withou unmounting)
have a look at ntfstools too. anyway, writing to an NTFS volume is not something i'd ever advice
Well, I reckon there are good reasons... but in my case I had to do it. I never had a problem at all with many tools: ntfsresize, captive, etc...
it's not something i'd *advice* doesn't mean it's not something i'd *do* ;-)
